oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee State Capitol
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tennessee State Capitol, Eastern Portico. View to the northwest, showing gate on Charlotte Ave. (Cedar Street); note individuals on Capitol grounds and sidewalks.

The Andrew Jackson equestrian statue was erected in front of the eastern portico of the Capitol in 1880.

Rodney Poole bought J. H. Van Stavoren's photography studio at a chancery court sale in 1871. In 1896, the Calvert brothers bought the studio from Poole.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Poole, Rodney, 1837-1921
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Calvert Brothers Studio Glass Plate Negatives
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Pedestrians; Government property; Porticoes; Architecture; Historic buildings
Capitols; Gates
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Box 86; Copy print in Library Photograph Collection, Drawer 23, Folder 70.
